intro: Homoianthus laevis, commonly known as the smooth-flowered homianthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
